questions.stem_text: Given the observation sequence O = (O1, O2), compute the probability of observing this sequence using the Forward Algorithm. Specifically, compute: P(O|λ) = ∑ St P(O, St|λ) where λ represents the model parameters.
questions.fusion_notes: Merged from 2 sources, used Vision for text, PyMuPDF for position

substring_mappings.original: Given the observation sequence O = (O1, O2), compute the probability of observing this sequence using the Forward Algorithm. Specifically, compute: P(O|λ) = ∑ St P(O, St|λ) where λ represents the model parameters.
substring_mappings.replacement: Given the observation sequence O = (O1, O2), compute the probability of observing this sequence using the Forward Algorithm. Specifically, compute: P(O|λ) = ∑ St P(O, St|λ) where λ represents the model parameters. [altered]

questions.stem_text: Given the same observation sequence O = (O1, O2), determine the most probable hidden state sequence using the Viterbi Algorithm, i.e., find: S* = arg max S P(S|O, λ) where S* is the most likely sequence of hidden states.
questions.fusion_notes: Merged from 2 sources, used Vision for text, PyMuPDF for position

stem.text: Given the observation sequence O = (O1, O2), compute the probability of observing this sequence using the Forward Algorithm. Specifically, compute: P(O|λ) = ∑ St P(O, St|λ) where λ represents the model parameters.

Given the same observation sequence O = (O1, O2), determine the most probable hidden state sequence using the Viterbi Algorithm, i.e., find: S* = arg max S P(S|O, λ) where S* is the most likely sequence of hidden states.
